form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mrs. Blackburn (for herself and Mr. Cornyn) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs

form.official-title: To prohibit cashless bail in the District of Columbia.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Ending Cashless Bail in Our Nation’s Capital Act.

section.header: Prohibiting cashless bail in the district of columbia
section.text: The District of Columbia shall not have in effect a policy or practice that—

paragraph.text: fails to allow for cash bail at the highest level necessary to ensure public safety, as appropriate, as a condition of pretrial release for a defendant that poses a clear threat to public safety and order, including—

subparagraph.text: a defendant charged with an offense involving—

clause.text: fleeing from a law enforcement officer;

subparagraph.text: a defendant charged with such an offense on multiple occasions; or

paragraph.text: fails to mandate or impose an automatic presumption of pretrial detention for all defendants charged with violent offenses, such as murder, rape, carjacking, sexual abuse of a minor, robbery, or burglary.
